column4: hey does anyone know if there is a way to force the wubi installer to use 150GB of space instead of just 30GB?
Why don't you install Ubuntu on it? ;)

well the wubi installer makes a file inside of windows to use instead of having a regular partiiton.  I chose to do it this way cause nobody could help me with my dualbooting problems but I could get it to install/dualboot correctly via wubi but there is a 30GB cap in the drop down box during the install process.  Do you know how to change/override this value?
Check this guide out -- Look for resize virtual disk -- https://wiki.ubuntu.com/WubiGuide
